intro: Randia oppositiflora, commonly known as the opposite-flowered randia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly in the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its opposite arrangement of leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Randia oppositiflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
